data.title: Ribs and sweet potatoes
data.text: This place has great ribs and steaks! Love their salads too. It's a little loud because it is always crowded. Close to home and movie theaters.

data.title: Great grilled chicken salad!
data.text: I am greeted at the door and when I belly up to the bar, Britny takes my order and I am on my way. The food comes out quickly and this chicken salad is the best in the area. Add that with the dinner rolls, butter and excellent service, what more could you ask for.

data.title: Road to goodness
data.text: I've been going to this restaurant for years. They cook the steak the way you want it or they redo it. The managers are always checking to see if your visit is going well. Wait staff is friendly and good.

data.title: This place makes a good steak!
data.text: My husband and I like to come here on Fridays for a date night. The food is always good but the service is never consistent. One day I will have a good server that is attentive in the next time I come in I will get a server who'd rather talk with their friends then make sure the customer has what they need.

data.title: Poor management
data.text: We ordered  ribs and steak medallion. Ribs were warm at best and steak was ordered medium come out grey , very well done . Sent the steak back and waited 15 minutes for a new one . They did not replace the sides which had gotten cold. After finding themanager  she said lI did not ask for new sides. A little common sense would help.When the bill was brought out it was for the full amount no apology no sorry just pay.i sent the bill the back and told the serve to give it to the manager . The bill finally came back with the steak removed.This was the Sandusky Ohio restruant . They need a manager with common sense and someone to run the kitchen. Needless to say we will not return for a long time.

data.title: Your average run of the mill steakhouse
data.text: I don't care for the buckets of peanuts in the shell everywhere.  It suggests this is a fun place but the food is not going to be that great.  It was, however, very inexpensive. My wife and I had the early dinner specials for $8.99 each.  I had the 6 oz. sirloin which was actually pretty good after it was recooked (it came out too rare the first time).  My wife had the country fried steak which she didn't care for - it wasn't that good and had some weird seasoning in it. I warned her not to get it!  The veggies looked like they came straight out of a can. The baked potatoes were decent except the skins were loaded with salt crystals so I couldn't eat them as I usually do.  The ambiance is one of a informal family restaurant.  The service was excellent.

data.title: Good steak for the price
data.text: As all Texas roadhouses. The steaks here are decent for the price. Always have to beware of the cook when ordering. Medium doesn't always end up medium when you receive it. But overall delicious food. The mashed potatoes are great

data.title: Good for date night
data.text: Texas Roadhouse is a great place to go if you want to take a date and not feel like your being cheap but you can relax. Its also a good family place too. The food is good, the drinks are good and it comfortable.

data.title: my new #1 place to eat
data.text: My first time at this location and its the best steak i can remember. Great service from the front door staff coming into and leaving. Our waitress came by table to ensure our food was prefect. I believe her name was karla working the tables farthest from the door. I use to eat at them places on middlebelt and 96 xway but this place is my #1 now and worth the drive.

data.title: Favorite place
data.text: Love love love the rolls and the butter. I get the chicken critters. Sooo good. This is my #1 restaurant.  Would recomend this place.

data.title: Fantastic
data.text: Have been many times, and it's always great.  Waitstaff has always been attentive even when busy.  Start out with asking for extra butter for the rolls.

data.title: Fun Atmosphere
data.text: We stopped for a drink after a long day. They didn't know how to make an old fashion, but that was okay. We had a snack and a drink and were served by a friendly, attentive young lady. At one point, a group of waitstaff joined together for a line dance. I know they all have peanuts, but nevertheless, we enjoyed munching on them.

data.title: Great service - fatty steak
data.text: This restaurant was very crowded- but the staff handled that like a well oiled machine. Great service, friendly and attentive staff. The food was decent- I would say average. The ribeye was exceptionally fatty ( I get that this cut of beef is typically not the most lean) and a bit over cooked. (ordered rare) The medallions were decent, also a bit overcooked, but nice and tender and lean. The sides were consistent with Texas Roadhouse and were good! Would probably choose somewhere else next time as this was just average.

data.title: Good service
data.text: When you first walk in they have all steaks on display.  If there's a wait they have a big waiting area.  We flagged down a waiter to get our waitress and both the manager and waitress came.  They really take care of the guests.  The hostess are really nice.  We had a waiter named TJ who was really good on a previous visit.

data.title: Use to love it!
data.text: We use to love this place. This was the best restaurant around but now it is horrible. We went there 3 times 1 month apart each time and it got worse each time we went. Food is getting to be poorly cooked and the service is beyond terrible. This was the best restaurant for service but it is now probably one of the worse. And the food is just made sloppy. Maybe another Texas road house would be better but for the one in Westland I'm done.

data.title: Good value
data.text: Pretty decent for this type of steakhouse.  Rolls are awesome.  Steak was good and prepared properly.  Sides were tasty.  Overall for an inexpensive family steakhouse I thought this was a good value.

data.title: Typical steakhouse, not worth the wait
data.text: This is a typical chain steakhouse, similar menu to what the Westland Charhouse used to offer right up the road as well as another steakhouse which used to reside in the next parking lot--both are out of business now, so they might want to step up their game. They do have good but greasy yeast rolls and I appreciate their effort to appease the vegetarians by providing a menu listing of a Country Veg Plate of a combination of sides chosen by the diner (although I suspect not all the "veggie" offerings are not truly vegetarian, as beans had pork, corn tasted meat-greasy, mashed potatoes seemed to be made with chicken broth,) but geez, it's $9 and I could get the same thing minus a side but adding a piece of steak for the same price during the early dine period! The place is packed on the weekends and their call-ahead  option doesn't work if you immediately get put on hold when you call to save a space and stay there for 15 minutes. That annoyance, along with having received subpar service from young waitstaff (new but unaccompanied? and then followed by a manager's visit to my table every time, which makes me think they know the service level is not up to the standard it should be!) during a couple of visits makes this dining experience not worth the wait to me. I did witness an amazing near-collision between a newby holding a full tray of food and a long-time waiter spinning around in the aisle during my last visit, it was more entertaining then the annoying birthday parades through the restaurant every five minutes--they really should stop making the staff do this as these distractions don't add value to the already-raucous atmosphere.

data.title: Unit cordinator
data.text: Had a wonderful meal!! Love there rolls!! Waite staff were wonderful!! Went on a Friday night was very busy!!  But had a very short wait to get a table. One of my favorite restaurant to go to.😀

data.title: Father's Day
data.text: We had a little wait, but not long for Father's day. The wait staff was amazing. The food was delicious and we had a nice relaxing meal. I will definitely be back.

data.title: Texas RoadHouse
data.text: Pretty average kind of place, except the bill. With two drinks, a shared appetizer, two steaks (not cooked how I like it (Pittsburgh Style) no dessert, $135.00 for two seems outrageous for a run of the mill steak house.
